//sendMessage(“You hit the door!”);

[/Quote]
Change the AddSkillXp to what xp you want
~Niels

item.title: Changing xp at dummies - help needed :)
item.dc:creator: @z4mor4k_m1n1on z4mor4k m1n1on
item.description:
@z4mor4k_m1n1on wrote:

ok so erase ur public void dummy and then add this

[code]
public void hitDummy()
{
if (FightType == 1) // attack

		addSkillXP(1200, 0);
		addSkillXP(1200, 3);
                    addSkillXP(1200, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	if (FightType == 2) // strength
	{
		addSkillXP(1200, 0);
		addSkillXP(1200, 3);
                    addSkillXP(1200, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
	if (FightType == 3) // defence
	{
		addSkillXP(1200, 0);
		addSkillXP(1200, 3);
                    addSkillXP(1200, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
	if (FightType == 4) // controlled
	{
		addSkillXP(1200, 0);
		addSkillXP(1200, 0);
		addSkillXP(1200, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 3);
                    addSkillXP(25, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
}
[/code]

item.title: Changing xp at dummies - help needed :)
item.dc:creator: @Daelil Daelil
item.description:
@Daelil wrote:

[code]public void hitDummy()
{
if (FightType == 1) // attack

		addSkillXP(3000, 0);
		addSkillXP(3000, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("People look at you fighting with a dummy and make shake thier heads.");
	if (FightType == 2) // strength
	{
		addSkillXP(3000, 0);
		addSkillXP(3000, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("People look at you fighting with a dummy and make shake thier heads.");
	}
	if (FightType == 3) // defence
	{
		addSkillXP(3000, 0);
		addSkillXP(3000, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("People look at you fighting with a dummy and make shake thier heads.");
	}
	if (FightType == 4) // controlled
	{
		addSkillXP(15, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 3);
                    addSkillXP(25, 13);
		//sendMessage("People look at you fighting with a dummy and make shake thier heads.");
	}
}

public void hitdoor()
{
//if(actionTimer == 0)
//{
addSkillXP((100playerLevel[2]), 2);
addSkillXP((50playerLevel[3]), 3);
//sendMessage(“You get frowned upon by the general public for acting like a retard and damaging property.”);
//}
}

public void hay()
{
addSkillXP(25, 1);
}[/code]

where do I type in what I want it to say when I hit hay and doors and what XP it should give?

Read full topic

item.title: Changing xp at dummies - help needed :)
item.dc:creator: @0ops_0wn3d 0ops 0wn3d
item.description:
@0ops_0wn3d wrote:

if (FightType == 1) // attack

		addSkillXP([glow=red,2,300]25[/glow], 0);
		addSkillXP([glow=red,2,300]15[/glow], 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	if (FightType == 2) // strength
	{

Change the highlighted number in all of them. Try to make them the same proportion changes also.
You can mess around with it till you get the amount you want cause I don’t feel like getting the exact numbers, I told you how now you gotta do your part right? Also I use a pimpscape source so it might be different but, should be same basic configuration.

[code]public void hitDummy()
{
if (FightType == 1) // attack

		addSkillXP(500, 0);
		addSkillXP(200, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	if (FightType == 2) // strength
	{
		addSkillXP(500, 0);
		addSkillXP(200, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
	if (FightType == 3) // defence
	{
		addSkillXP(500, 0);
		addSkillXP(200, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
	if (FightType == 4) // controlled
	{
		addSkillXP(250, 0);
		addSkillXP(250, 0);
		addSkillXP(250, 0);
		addSkillXP(250, 3);
                    addSkillXP(25, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
}

public void hitdoor()
{
//if(actionTimer == 0)
//{
addSkillXP((500playerLevel[2]), 2);
addSkillXP((300playerLevel[3]), 3);
//sendMessage(“You hit the door!”);
//}
}

public void hay()
{
addSkillXP(500, 1);
}[/code]
That’s an estimate of getting lvls from 1 to 10 in one click… but like I said you might have to change.

Read full topic
item.source: Changing xp at dummies - help needed :)

item.title: Changing xp at dummies - help needed :)
item.dc:creator: @Daelil Daelil
item.description:
@Daelil wrote:

I was wandering whether anyone could tell me exactly what I should do to change xp at dummies, ive got testscape source and this is exactly what it says:

[code]public void hitDummy()
{
if (FightType == 1) // attack

		addSkillXP(25, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	if (FightType == 2) // strength
	{
		addSkillXP(25, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
	if (FightType == 3) // defence
	{
		addSkillXP(25, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 3);
                    addSkillXP(50, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
	if (FightType == 4) // controlled
	{
		addSkillXP(15, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 0);
		addSkillXP(15, 3);
                    addSkillXP(25, 13);
		//sendMessage("You hit the dummy!");
	}
}

public void hitdoor()
{
//if(actionTimer == 0)
//{
addSkillXP((100playerLevel[2]), 2);
addSkillXP((50playerLevel[3]), 3);
//sendMessage(“You hit the door!”);
//}
}

public void hay()
{
addSkillXP(25, 1);
}[/code]

Basically I wanted to know what xp i should put in so you could get to lvl 1 attack to 10 in 1 click, make it easy to get lvl 80 or 90 attack (5 or 10 minutes)
oh and please tell me where to put it, ur just copy my code and edit it for me and repost so I can copy on to mine, that would be very helpfull

Read full topic
item.source: Changing xp at dummies - help needed :)
